comments.text: No mention of the designer who was the talent behind the women, Nolan Miller? Or the fact that each of the women are wearing their best colors, due to the color me beautiful trend at the time.
comments.author: @christinehuband4383

comments.text: Love Dynasty ❤
comments.author: @samutracio

comments.text:
Before we dive in, I want to say something important.

This video is all about how Dynasty shaped the fashion of the 1980s — the power shoulders, the unapologetic glamour, the drama, the silhouettes that practically screamed confidence. Dynasty wasn’t just a TV show — it was a fashion phenomenon that redefined what power dressing looked like.

And you were absolutely right to point out that I didn’t mention the designers and costume creators behind those iconic looks. That’s on me — and honestly, they deserve their own spotlight.

So very soon, I’ll be releasing a separate video in English where I’ll talk specifically about the designers and costume designers who shaped the visual identity of the show and, in many ways, the entire decade.

Thank you for keeping the conversation sharp and thoughtful. I love that you notice these details — it makes this space so much more interesting. Stay tuned ❤
comments.author: @FashionQuestion

comments.text: No mention of the designer who was the talent behind the women, Nolan Miller? Or the fact that each of the women are wearing their best colors, due to the color me beautiful trend at the time.

comments.text: Love Dynasty ❤
comments.author: @samutracio

comments.text:
1. It's interesting that you said in 3:23 that Dominique's wardrobe "merged luxurious texture with bold, saturated colors such as emerald green, ruby red and deep sapphire" while in fact, if you're a Dynasty viewer you would know that the majority of her wardrobe's were all in soft, sophisticated ivory, cream, white, cafe au lait brown,  pale grey, pearly beige, jet black and silvery/gold mettallics. Her very luxurious, muted elegant wardrobe's are supposed to be the antithesis of Alexis ' brash, loud costumes that often featured in bold, saturated jewel colors!
2. Why not mentioning Nolan Miller, the costume designer of the show?
comments.author: @azabujuban-hito-dake

comments.text:
I would love to know what happened to all those clothes? If I were an actress on that set, I would have had it in my contract that I get the option to keep my wardrobe after all the taping was completed.
Funny story: I was working as surgical assistant to a female doctor when some Dynasty aired in Nepal. She was a MD, (medical missionary) and I was her go-to person doing many of the pre- and post-surgical reviews on the patients (GYN) as well as first (only) assistant in the OR. So, I go to one family's little home to check on a patient, and they were not there. I was told via hand signs that there were in a small building, so I went there. What did I see? A very small black and white TV with Dynasty playing. This was the village's favorite program, and the ENTIRE village was there. They thought ALL American's lived like that!! Well, I saw my patient. Ask her a few questions to close out her record. I also made sure they knew that I was an American and that what I made in 1 year could not pay for 1 of those outfits.
comments.author: @MARYREED-nh7gb

comments.text:
The outfits from Dynasty are so beautiful and elegant that I'm afraid to rewatch the series. Because after watching it, I won't want to dress modern. 😄 
Thank you, dear Valerie, for this breath of nostalgia. ❤
comments.author: @NatalyaSesk
